Fields.DialogueText: *BOOM*
That's a huge Morgana fleet. We're taking heavy fire!
Don't worry, Captain. I have a plan!
Oh, no.
My pilots are strafing the enemy fleet, like so--
*KABOOM*
We go straight down the middle while they're distracted and take down their flagship.

Fields.MenuText: Glorious, that's insane.
You're going to get us all killed.
There's not a chance in hell this will work!

Fields.DialogueText: It's a risk. That's not the same thing.
We have the firepower, and I have the brains. We'll make it.
Don't tell me the odds, Captain!
There's too many of them, and we can't just charge them. Even with air support.
Well, we've already started--
*BLAM*
Let's salvage this mess, then.
@BATTLE
Glorious, that was reckless.
We survived, didn't we?
Yes, but that's not the point.
I had a plan. I had luck on my side. We survived.
And we might not if you pull that crap again.
Understood, Captain.
As of right now... we're on shore leave. So I'll drop the subject. But if  this happens again--
It won't, it won't. ... Say...
What is it?
Captain, there's a tavern right up against the dock.
If you're up for a drink...

Fields.MenuText: I can't right now, sorry.
I don't drink.
I'd love to, but... you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Say no more, Captain. Duty calls, all that.
I understand, Captain. If you change your mind, just say the word.
Ah, that's too bad. We'll never see if I could drink you under the table.
... Ugh, my contact's waiting for me. I'll see you later, Captain.
We have to get out of here. Cover the rear while we turn around.
Aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Contact?
Tell you later, Captain. I have to go!
*sigh*
I finally have time to catch up on my reports. But the ship feels so empty without Glorious aboard...
It's too quiet. Why do I feel like something terrible is about to happen?
*BLAM*
... Right on schedule. That's the rest of the big fleet.
Glorious? Where the hell did you go--
Right, she said the tavern at the dock.
Glorious? What are you--
Outta my way, you--
Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!
*WHACK*
The next one to insult my pilots loses their teeth.
*BOOM*
Glorious, we're under *attack!* What do you think you're doing?!
I was waiting for my contact! And then this - *gentleman* - decided to give me a hard time.
I don't care if he called your mother a dog's breakfast. You can't do this.
He can insult my mother all he wants, she doesn't exist. My *sisters,* on the other hand...
*ALARM*
Hear that? The port needs us. We have to go.
What about that lunkhead? He needs to be taught a lesson.
You can have your fisticuffs after we fend off the Morganas!
@BATTLE
I can't believe you tried to start a bar brawl during a Morgana raid.
I didn't start anything. I finished it.
The port hasn't taken too much damage. But I still need to find my contact.
What kind of "contact" would you find in a dump like that?
Take a guess, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Military intelligence?
The Royal Mail?
It's someone unsavory, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: Got it in one, Captain.
No. But that reminds me, I'm overdue to send my sister something...
An oxymoron, Captain!  No, Jimmy's a civilian...
Wotcha, Glory. Who've you got here?
No one important.
Then ditch this sucker. We've got to talk about the - stuff.
Captain? Can you give us a moment?
No, I want to know what's going on.
There's nothin' goin' on. I just need to talk to the lady.
We've got a business arrangement. It's nothing to worry about.
I don't like this one bit.
*ALARM*
Wrap this up *pronto.*
This will only take a second, Captain. Please--
Aye aye.
@BATTLE
Glorious. You found some more new friends?
Ah! Who are you talking about, Captain? I'm by myself, I swear.
That may be so, but... weren't you talking to "Jimmy" about your "business arrangement?"
I might have been, but I don't see what--
The dock's crawling with civilians. And they're loading *something* aboard.
It's on my order, Captain! We need more ballast.
More ballast.
Mm. And Jimmy, bless his heart, he's always a businessman - he agreed to let *us* take on some cargo he needs transported.
We get our ballast, he gets to know his cargo is in our capable hands. Everyone wins.
Somehow I think you're not telling me the whole truth.
Why not?

Fields.MenuText: Those crates look pretty light.
Jimmy seems like a crook.
You're a rotten liar, Glorious.

Fields.DialogueText: In bulk? They're heavier than they look.
I can assure you, he's aboveboard. As much as you and I.
Then ask me no questions, Captain.
*ALARM*
Battle stations, people! We'll deal with the rest of the cargo later.
... You can't just lug a ton of cargo aboard without someone signing off on it.
Better to ask forgiveness than permission.
Does that mean I can keep it?
Don't push your luck.
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me privately, Captain?
That's right. Sit down.
... Captain? Is this about the cargo?
How did you guess?
... Like I said, better to ask forgiveness than permission. So... I'm sorry, Captain.
You are forgiven. But...
I can't have this cargo aboard, Glorious. I don't know what's in it, you don't know what's in it--
You're making some assumptions there, Captain.
So if you know what's in it, why won't you tell me?
Because it's not important.

Fields.MenuText: I need to know what's going on aboard my ship.
You can't keep hiding things from me forever.
It's important to me, Glorious.

Fields.DialogueText: ... It's... it's just crates, Captain.
And I don't intend to, really! It's just a few crates, Captain.
And you do, Captain! It's just a few crates.
It may only be crates, but I don't want mystery crates aboard. Who knows what could be in them?
Your friend could be a saboteur. Or a foreign spy, or--
*ALARM*
I want those crates off my ship.
Yes, Captain. For now, let's take care of the bigger problem. Before it takes care of us.
@BATTLE
Mail call, Glorious. We've got something for you...
Oh, what is it?
It's a letter from Furious. Addressed to you.
Oh, that's my sister! Let me see, Captain?
Here you go.
Furious, you... absolute... wet blanket.
What, what'd she say?
She called me a "terrible sister." Me! Just because I don't have the time to write back.... or take her calls...

Fields.MenuText: That isn't exactly sisterly...
You have enough time to make dodgy deals with weirdos.
I don't think you're a *bad* sister, per se...

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly what I'm going to tell her, Captain!
Well, it's not *unsisterly* either. She should know I've got a lot on my plate right now!
That's different, Captain.
I'm on a very important mission, Captain. She ought to understand that...
I wouldn't exactly call routine patrols "important."
What? Pssh. I didn't mean our mission from the Fleet.
Hm? Something from your bosses?
Let's call it a personal quest, Captain.
*ALARM*
And here I was going to ask what your secret mission was.
It'll have to stay a secret, Captain.
If you say so.
@BATTLE
... Oh dear.
Glorious... what are you doing with those crates?
Huh? Wh- what crates, Captain?
The mystery crates. You know...
The ones I *specifically told you* I wanted off my ship.
These? These aren't those crates. I got those off the ship. These are... different crates.
Uh-huh. Also from your "friend" Jimmy?
Well...

Fields.MenuText: This is insubordination, Glorious.
You can't just take on mystery cargo.
I *need* to know what you're up to, Glorious. For the good of the ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course you do, Captain! It's just-- it's-- It's all such a mess--
Of course not, but I know exactly what's inside these boxes!
Of course, and I'm sorry, Captain, but there's a perfectly good explanation for this--
If I tell you the truth, will you let me keep them?
Well--
*ALARM*
We'll see, Glorious. Let's deal with the Morganas.
"We'll see?" ... That just means "no."
@BATTLE
All right, Glorious. I'll give you the chance. Explain yourself.
Captain... where do I even start...
How about the beginning.
... Jimmy's a spiv, Captain. Do you know what that means?

Fields.MenuText: He's a war profiteer.
He's a smuggler.
He's... a lady's man.

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain! I assure you, what we've got is all business.
Got it in one, Captain.
Not the way you mean, Captain.
A spiv's a smuggler who tries to get around rationing. If you need cigarettes or tea, Jimmy's your man.
Those crates are a bit big for cigarettes...
Well, so's our cargo.
It's meat, Captain.
... What?
The boxes. They're a couple hundred pounds of mutton. Jimmy's got them from all over the country.
He's got contacts in Northern Ireland. One of them will pick the meat up, and pay me for my trouble.
... Meat.
Yes, Captain.
You put my crew in danger... put the both of us at risk of a court-martial... for *meat.*
It's more complicated than that, Captain! The payment is good--
I don't care how much you're getting paid! This whole situation is ridiculous--
*ALARM*
Can we talk about this later, Captain? With cooler heads?
... Fine. But we *will* be talking about this later.
Of course, Captain! I'm sure the problem will solve itself.
@BATTLE
So, uh, Captain... about the meat...
Yes?
Have... have you decided what we're going to do with it?
I don't want to let my business partners down, but if I have to...
Best bite that bullet quickly, you know?
I thought about it, and I decided...
We'll keep it aboard. You can give it to your "friend" when we get there.
Really, Captain? Oh, thank you! Thank you so much. I knew you were the right choice.
Save it, Glorious. This was a practical decision.
If I may, Captain, what made you change your mind?

Fields.MenuText: People are hungry. I can't throw away food under these circumstances.
*Stopping* you would be more work than any consequence.
I admit to being swayed by the extra supplies he threw in.

Fields.DialogueText: Always the altruist, eh? Well, I'll give you the chance to help.
Damn straight, Captain! Pardon my French.
Everyone has a price.
*ALARM*
Well. They couldn't come in at a better time.
Just be careful with your meat, Glorious.
I've hauled it this far, haven't I?
@BATTLE
... Where, exactly, did he get it?
Can't say. His price - among other things - is secrecy.
Thanks for having me for dinner. Always good to sit down with my captain.
Always good to sit down with my Belle.
Mm, I'll drink to that.
And I wouldn't have, six months ago. My hunch paid off, huh?
Your hunch?
Oh, I asked for a transfer.
I remember. The Fleet said you were quite... persistent.
That's right. Would you believe I put in a request fifteen times?
Fifteen?!
Everyone says you're the best captain in the entire fleet.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I don't like to boast...
You must not have talked to many people.
I'm just doing my duty.

Fields.DialogueText: More than you can say for most people.
Then don't.
Oh, trust me. The Belles and sailors I talked to? They all say you're the best.
So... what was your hunch?
That you'd be better than my last captain. And I was right.
Maybe I'm just more of a pushover.
@BATTLE
Nope, Captain. You don't treat anyone like they're expendable.
How do you figure?
In all the time I've been aboard, you've never once treated me like a machine. You treat me like a person.
You treat me like I *matter.*
Of course you matter. You're our Belle. You keep us safe--
Well, looks like it's time for me to "keep you safe" again.
I look forward to it.
Hm. Got a ship to the starboard. Looks like a friendly.
German, by the look of her... Doesn't look armed.
This is WBS 11, weather ship Hessen, message, over.
This is Glorious, we're reading you loud and clear, Hessen, over.
Spotted a fleet of witches ten klicks east, over.
Roger. We'll take care of them.
That's not necessary! There are too many of them. Sit tight and wait for reinforcements, over.
We'll take your advice into consideration, over.
Captain, this is a farce.
How do you figure?
If they didn't want us going east, they couldn't have picked a flimsier excuse. We're Morgana hunters.

Fields.MenuText: That may be so.
A weather ship isn't exactly going to lie.
We are, and I don't like their attitude.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe so, but...
So let's not put up with their horse hockey, Captain!
Yes! I knew you'd listen to me.
We'll be careful out there. Over and out.
So we'll be going east, right?
*ALARM*
We'll figure it out after we deal with *these* Morganas.
Really, they couldn't be any more transparent...
@BATTLE
I still think we should go east.
Hm? Why?
The German weather ship said we shouldn't go that way.
Yes, and they were acting really suspicious. Wouldn't you agree?

Fields.MenuText: Not really. They were trying to help.
It *is* strange for them to tell a Fleet ship that...
Whether or not they were acting strangely, it's not our business.

Fields.DialogueText: It's exactly our business, Captain!
Exactly, Captain!
Help, schmelp. They're trying to misdirect us.
If there's a huge fleet of Morganas pissing about... taking care of them is our job.
What about your meat?
It'll keep, Captain.
You just don't like being lied to, do you?
Who does, Captain?
*ALARM*
Well, they were telling the truth about one thing. There's Morganas about.
There's always Morganas about.
Let's deal with them quick and get back to business.
@BATTLE
I have a hunch. We need to look into this.
Well...
Trust me, Captain. Like I trust my gut.
Well, we're going east. I hope your hunch was right.
They always are, Captain. Like I said - I trust my gut.
Well, let's hope you don't have indigestion.
... Look over there, Captain. That's a *lot* of ships.
They feel like Morganas?
Negative. They're friendlies. ...I think.
Halt! You've entered German waters. Turn back, now.
I beg your bloody pardon? We're off the Dutch coast.
You must be lost.
By the terms of the treaty, we must *request* that you leave.
You people are crazy!
*ALARM*
Can this day get any better?

Fields.MenuText: Chin up, Glorious. We'll get out of this.
Don't say that! It can always get worse.
Let's not try and find out.

Fields.DialogueText: My luck is better than that, Captain!
Very prudent of you. But I'm lucky enough that we'll get out of this one.
Of course, Captain. My luck will pull us out of this.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You've got to be kidding me.
Well, you were right about one thing.
What's that, Captain?
That's a *lot* of ships.
I know. I *know!*
Give me six seconds and you'll have a plan--

Fields.MenuText: Can we use the fog?
Can we outmaneuver them?
Can we radio for reinforcements?

Fields.DialogueText: Between the Morganas and the blockade? We've barely got enough space to maneuver.
Negative, Captain. We don't know if this is a rogue element or a plan. They might have *friends* nearby.
You know, you might be onto something there...
We use the fog to hide, try to slip away. *Then* we call the Fleet, then we go on our merry.
My meat still gets delivered on schedule, and the mystery's dealt with.
*RAT-TAT-TAT*
I don't have a better plan. Let's try to lose them!
Affirmative, Captain!
@BATTLE
The Fleet ship is getting away! Stop them!
Oh, no you don't.
Captain, look over there! The Belle of that ship--
Hmm?
It's hard to see her in the fog, but... I feel like I know her from somewhere...

Fields.MenuText: We've probably crossed paths.
If she's shooting at us, she's the enemy.
Worry about that AFTER we get out of this.

Fields.DialogueText: Bloodthirsty of you, Captain.
Yes, Captain.
Probably. Still, I can't shake the feeling...
Goddammit! The fog's clearing!
We're going to have to fight our way through. Concentrate our fire on the Morganas--
And if you can, avoid shooting the human ships! They're not our enemy, no matter what their captain is trying to pull.
Yes, Captain. We'll find a way out of this yet!
@BATTLE
Told you I have all the luck.
Allllllll of it.
Don't *push* your luck.
Status report. How are we holding up?
Could be worse, Captain. No serious damage, and we've shaken them.
... Wait. Something's coming out of the fog.
Glorious? Is that you?
Please take me with you. Let me join your captain. Mine is cruel--
Please. If I run away, I don't have anywhere else to go.
... You need to go back.
Huh?!
If you go back now, you can say you got lost in the fog.
If he doesn't realize you're gone, he can't punish you.
But--

Fields.MenuText: This isn't like you, Glorious.
Tell her I wish I could take her on, but...
We have to follow Fleet orders. She can't come with us.

Fields.DialogueText: Wilco, Captain.
... I'm not a child, Captain. Why do you think I said what I said?
No. It isn't.
You have to turn back. I'm sorry.
... I'm sorry.
Don't apologize to me. We've still got to get back on track.
For the sake of your meat, if nothing else.
Of course, Captain.
@BATTLE
Out of the firing range, into the fog! We're almost in the clear!
Well, what's done is done.
Did you call the Fleet?
Radioed them as soon as we were safe to.
They said they'd look into... all this.
If they *do* anything about it, I'll buy you a drink.
In fact, I owe you a couple drinks anyway.
For what?
Getting us out of there in one piece.
My plan could have worked, but I hit a run of bad luck. You bailed us out.

Fields.MenuText: Credit where it's due. I know of at least one gunner who deserves a raise.
It's what I do best.
Your plans should be able to survive a few hiccups. Read your Clausewitz.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know. Friction and all that.
You should do it for a living. Oh, wait...
If not a promotion. But Captain... don't get too used to humility.
*ALARM*
Just when I thought we were out of the woods...
Chin up. It's a little fleet. Just a few ships.
Let's give them a little hell.
@BATTLE
This from someone whose name is literally Glorious.
It's a rough war out there, Captain. Take the prizes you're given.
I can't help but feel like we messed up back there.
With the blockade? We muddle through the best we can. No regrets.
That was part of it, but....
The Belle. The one that tried to hail us in the fog. I can't shake the feeling...
Ah. You too, huh?
Yeah, I... I wanted to help her, too. But I choked, Captain.
It didn't seem in character for you.
Do you like ghost stories, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: What do they have to do with anything?
I like them from time to time.
They're not really my thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Humour me, Captain.
Then you'll know how these things go.
I've got a morbid fascination with them.
There's more than one kind of haunting, Captain. Sometimes, people haunt you while they're still alive.
You're talking about your old Captain, aren't you.
Mm. When you have a bastard like that in command, all you can do is pray you don't get caught.
This explains a lot about you.
I told our mystery Belle to cover things up, because it was the only thing that would work.
All it explains is why I'll never be sober again if I can help it.
*ALARM*
And honestly, those old girls don't help.
Let's take care of them.
@BATTLE
Well, I have good news and bad news. Which do you want first?
Give us the goods, Captain.
The blockade wasn't an organised effort.
It was a couple of rogue captains, and my contacts in the Fleet say they've been dealt with.
That's such good news, I can't help but worry about the bad.
You got a commendation.
Is that so.
So you'll have to be on your best behaviour for a hot second.
Please tell me that this won't take us off course.

Fields.MenuText: What would you say if it did?
Why, are you afraid your "friend" will bust your kneecaps?
Are you worried about your meatlegging career?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! It's nothing *that* dramatic, I hope.
Jimmy is a perfect gentleman.
Let's hope so, for the sake of your knees.
I'd be very put out.
Please don't leave me hanging, Captain. Will I get to deliver my meat?
They want to meet you *after* this patrol is complete.
Phew. You saved my bacon.
*ALARM*
And I'm going to do it again. Come on!
@BATTLE
It's mail call, Glorious.
I know.
Are you expecting another letter?
Mm. And sending one.

Fields.MenuText: Who's the lucky guy?
Is this for your sister?
You don't normally *send* letters...

Fields.DialogueText: No. But I'm going to make the effort.
Right on the money, Captain.
Mm, making some assumptions, aren't you? It's for my sister.
I keep leaving people behind. The other Belle... my old crew... and... and Courageous.
I can't leave Furious behind, too.
Even if she is a wet blanket.
Courageous?
... My... other sister.
*ALARM*
You never told me you had another sister.
I'll tell you about her *later.*
Let's get these Morganas so I can make my delivery!
@BATTLE
Here's the goods, as promised.
Mm, you didn't skim anything off the top?
You can weigh the crates if you want, but trust me, it's all there.
I was starting to think you'd never get here, pet.
Now, where's my payment?
All here, as promised.
In gold?
As promised.
Pleasure doing business with you.
'Ta.
I don't like you getting mixed up with these people, Glorious.
And yet you let me anyway?
Well--
Here, help me get my payment aboard.
Ooof! This feels like a bag of rocks.
Scuse you. They're *shiny* rocks.
And they're going to get me my sister back.
Furious? How...?
No. Courageous.

Fields.MenuText: Didn't she sink?
How will a suitcase of gold help you do *that?*
I don't understand what's going on, but... I want to help.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. Yes, she did.
Well, I'm trying to--
Thanks, Captain. It makes things easier, knowing you're in my corner.
*ALARM*
Now's not the time, but-- I want to hear more about this.
I'll meet you for a drink. *After* we fend off the Morganas.
Deal.
@BATTLE
Ah, you've always got the good stuff, Captain.
If I didn't know you were a paragon of virtue, I'd say you have *connections* too.
Mm, we just travel a lot.
Whatever you say, Captain.
Let's get to the point. You said you were going to tell me about your sister?
Mmhm. ... I can't tell you everything, because some of it isn't mine to tell. But... the short version...
Go on.
Courageous was ... the best of all of us. Brave, strong, loyal, kind. The works. When the Morganas sank her...
I didn't know how to go on. It nearly broke me. Until I realized something.
Belles can come back from the dead. At least... in theory.

Fields.MenuText: Do you mean... like how Morganas do?
I've heard of that happening...
And you want to bring back your sister?

Fields.DialogueText: That's exactly it, Captain.
I did too. And that's where I got the idea.
If *that* happened, we'd never have a casualty report again.
We can rebuild her, Captain. Courageous, just like she used to be.
The Admiralty said that we couldn't afford to. Not enough cash on hand. But that's a problem I can fix.
I earn the money, bring it to the Admiralty, and with any luck, they'll bring her back to me.
That's a gamble. How do you know they'll spend it on her?
I don't. But I'm willing to take the risk.
*ALARM*
Ugh. We were having a *moment,* here.
Well, the drinks will have to wait. But... Thank you for telling me... all of this. It means a lot.
Does it?
You're enough of a gambler to keep your hand close to your chest.
Well, the cards are on the table now.
They are. And I'll help you make your play.
@BATTLE
And I'm sure that shady Russian friend of yours is a travel agent.
Lugin? Well... It's not like he's acting on my orders.
Twenty-three, twenty-*four*, twenty-*five...* why are these so slippery?
Glorious? What are you doing in there?
Captain! Come in quick, and close the door!
All right...?
Whoa! Why are all your gold bars on the floor?
I'm counting them out, Captain!
Making sure there's as many as I was promised... and that none of them have been shaved down.
Well, that's a noble goal, but--
But what?
But, uh, the ship *sways... *
So?
*THUNK*
Ow, ow, my ankle--
Ah! I'll catch you--
Are you, uh - are you all right?
You elbowed my... chest, Captain.
Oh dear. I'm just going to pretend this didn't happen--
You don't *have* to.

Fields.MenuText: I tripped on your gold. That's embarrassing enough.
Are you saying you want me in your arms?
That's a bit close to fraternization.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, I won't *tell* anyone that you bruised your dignity.
A *lady* would never say that, Captain.
Something tells me you don't have a problem with that, Captain.
*ALARM*
Whether you like it or not... we have to get up.
Ugh. Fine.
And stow your gold once the fighting's over! We don't want anyone else to trip.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Another month, another shore leave.
And it couldn't come soon enough, Captain!
You can say that again.
Say... I still owe you a drink, Captain.
Hm?
The INPF *did* look into the blockade, and I said if anything came of it, I'd buy you a drink.
Well, I'd love to take you up on that. But I have one question...
Fire away, Captain.
Is this a friendly outing, or something a little more... intimate?
Does it have to be one or the other, Captain?
What do you mean?
Do we have to *decide* whether this is friendship or... something else?
We can have a few drinks, see where the night takes us.
Hmmm. I don't really feel comfortable with that.
No? Are you not interested?
Ah, it's not that. I just... need solid ground to stand on, you know?
Ugh, I hate solid ground. Give me the open sea any day.
Unlike you, I'm not a ship.
All right. You can pick the terms of engagement. What do *you* want out of this, Captain?
Awfully generous of you.
All right. For now, I want...

Fields.MenuText: ... a friendly outing.
... a night on the town. We'll see where things go.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, nobody's perfect.
You're on! I'll drink you under the table, Captain!
You sure, Captain? That's not what you said a minute ago...
Actions speak louder than words.
You want to keep things flexible. I respect that. But if you want to ... if you want there to be something between us...
Then watch me act!
You say that like there isn't already.
You can take me out to sea any time.
I'm always happy to sail with my Captain.
